interface joint

Definition of a joint.

Properties from joint

[Rotating and soft rod only] Max length of the joint.

Public Properties

aa gmm.d.ts:563 
aa: vector2d

vector2d

[Rotating and soft rod only] First attachment offset, as a 2d vector. Relative to the first attachment's platform.

Read more about vectors here.

ab gmm.d.ts:569 
ab: vector2d

vector2d

[Rotating and soft rod only] Second attachment offset, as a 2d vector. Relative to the second attachment's platform. If there's no specified second platform (bb == -1), it's absolute (relative to world) instead.

Read more about vectors here.

ba gmm.d.ts:552 
ba: number

number

ID of the first platform attached.

bb gmm.d.ts:556 
bb: number

number

ID of the second platform attached.

To make the joint have no second attachment, set this value to -1. Path and springy joints should also have it set to -1.

d gmm.d.ts:546 
d: jointD

jointD

A collection of diverse joint parameters.

It is unknown why Chaz decided to make a separate collection just for these properties.

len gmm.d.ts:576 
len: number

number

[Rotating and soft rod only] Max length of the joint.

type gmm.d.ts:536 
type: "rv" | "d" | "lpj" | "lsj"

"rv" | "d" | "lpj" | "lsj"

Joint type.

Can be:

  • "rv": A rotating joint,
  • "d": A soft rod joint,
  • "lpj": A follow path joint,
  • "lsj": A springy joint.
